sect2.title: Installing a License
sect2.para: A WebRadar License is installed using the License link displayed via the Admin tab.
The Change button displays a text-area where you can paste your license provided by Ephox. The Validate button will store the license details in WebRadar.

sect2.title: Scheduling Data Extraction
sect2.para: Before you generate reports using WebRadar, you need to update the WebRadar cache with content from WCM. This caching is performed by the Data Extractor link, located under the Admin tab in WebRadar.
Caching data from WCM occurs automatically. The Cache Status field indicates whether WebRadar is currently caching data from WCM.
When WebRadar is currently rebuilding the cache then the progress of the extraction is shown in Cache status.
Using the Select Libraries link WebRadar can be configured to cache specific WCM libraries.
Making any changes to the Select Libraries dialog and clicking the Update Cache button will schedule an update of the WebRadar cache to reflect the new selected library list.

sect3.title: Scheduling Suspensions
sect3.para: Scheduled suspensions specify periods of time when the extraction process will not occur. Use the Add Schedule button to add a new schedule.

sect3.title: Rebuilding Cache
sect3.para: The Rebuild Cache button will completely rebuild the WebRadar cache used for reports. Use this button if you feel your WebRadar cache (populated by extractions) has been corrupted. Rebuild Cache performs a complete and comprehensive data extraction, which may take a significant amount of time. Also, the data visible in WebRadar will not be an accurate reflection of all content in the selected WCM libraries until this extraction is complete.

sect2.title: Subscription Email Configuration
sect2.para:
The Email Configuration tab allows you to modify the settings required for WebRadar to be able to send email subscriptions to its users. There are four options that can be modified:
Subscription Run Time — The time each day when you wish subscription emails to be sent out. A choice of starting times ranging between 00:00 (12am) and 23:45 (11:45pm) at 15 minute intervals.
SMTP Server — The mail server you would like to use to dispatch mail.
Username — Optional username for the SMTP if your server requires one.
Password — Optional password for the SMTP if your server requires one.
